alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:44PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Claiborne, western Hancock and southwestern Lee Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cubage, or 12 miles east of Middlesboro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sneedville, Rose Hill, Evanston, Ewing and Powell River Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
